primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Melting Mann land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Melting Mann? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Melting Mann scored 44 out of 100. Grassroots tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Melting Mann. Vandalia, Michigan. 62 mi. Rolling Michigan farmland gravel with spring thaw conditions.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Value. 4 out of 5. One of the better deals in gravel. Starting at $75 individual entry with tiered pricing that maxes at $90 for 750+ registrants is reasonable for a full day experience. Expenses. 4 out of 5. Budget carefully. The extras get you. Vandalia Community Center staging keeps venue costs low, with packet pickup Friday evening or Saturday morning for convenience. Length. 3 out of 5. Long enough to matter. Short enough to recover. Three distances at 24, 38, and 58 miles with staggered starts from 9am to 10:45am manage traffic flow effectively. Community. 3 out of 5. Good vibes. Riders actually talk to each other. "People come back year after year because they fall in love with the vibe, the people, and the challenge. Logistics. 2 out of 5. You'll figure it out. Eventually. Pete Post praised race director Mark Wright's first-year execution: "The volunteers were super helpful, the swag and race prizes were awesome. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Some chunky bits. Nothing catastrophic. Mann Road's "sandy dirt uphill" claims riders "whose wheels get stuck, lose traction or topple" right after the ski area descent. Elevation. 2 out of 5. Some ups and downs. Manageable. Called a 'roller coaster' course with 2500 feet of gain over 62 miles, which works out to manageable rollers rather than sustained climbs. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mild conditions. Nothing dramatic. March weather swings wildly—Pete Post raced through 3 inches of fresh snow in 2014 while 2025 saw 35°F temps.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Adventure. 2 out of 5. Light adventure. Nothing wild. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Nothing special about the race execution. Experience. 2 out of 5. A nice day on the bike. Nothing more. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Zero name recognition. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Sparse start line. Plenty of elbow room.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Spring Thaw Grassroots Ride. Only if you're in Michigan and want an affordable early-season gravel ride. Not worth traveling for.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Melting Mann isn't quite right for you. For better Michigan events: Barry-Roubaix, Lumberjack 100. For similar grassroots vibes: other regional Midwest spring events.
